title: Do You Put Coconut Oil on Wet or Dry Hair? The Best Ways to Lock in Moisture

steps.title: Both options are equally good—it depends on what your goal is.
steps.content: Both options are equally good—it depends on what your goal is. If you put the oil in dry hair, it will get some protection from the elements. If you put the oil in wet hair, it will help to lock in nutrients and moisture to keep your hair healthy and smooth. They’re both good options, so feel free to use it with either wet or dry hair. You can even use it in your dry hair, shower an hour later, and reapply it to get the best of both worlds! [1] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Think of it this way, in dry hair, coconut oil will protect. [2] X Expert Source Mindy Nguyen Holistic Cosmetologist Expert Interview. 8 October 2021. In wet hair, coconut oil will keep it healthy. That’s probably the simplest way to explain it!

steps.title: You can use it as a pre-wash treatment for dry or curly hair.
steps.content: You can use it as a pre-wash treatment for dry or curly hair. Without putting any coconut oil directly on your scalp, scoop a glob up and work it into your hair by hand about an hour or two before you shower. The oil will keep your hair from drying out before you shampoo. [3] X Research source This may not be the best choice if you have naturally thin hair. The oil can end up being too much for your hair if it isn’t especially thick.

steps.title: You can apply it to damaged or split ends to smooth them.
steps.content: You can apply it to damaged or split ends to smooth them. There are zero products out there that will fix split or damaged ends. However, coconut oil can hide this kind of damage by holding the strands together and giving them some sheen. Simply rub a little bit of coconut oil into the last 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm) of your hair and you’re done! [4] X Research source

steps.title: You can use it as an overnight hair mask for deep hydration.
steps.content: You can use it as an overnight hair mask for deep hydration. Work a glob or two of coconut oil into your hair before going to bed for the night. [5] X Expert Source Mindy Nguyen Holistic Cosmetologist Expert Interview. 8 October 2021. You can put a shower cap on if you’re worried about ruining any pillow cases. When you wake up, shampoo and cleanse in the shower to strip any remaining oil that hasn’t soaked into your hair. This should give your hair a shinier, smoother feel. [6] X Research source

steps.title: It will help lock in moisture but it's important to rinse it out thoroughly.
steps.content: It will help lock in moisture but it's important to rinse it out thoroughly. Coconut oil does not moisturize on its own (no oil does—oil and water don’t mix). However, oils are occlusive, meaning that they lock in whatever is in your hair. When you moisturize or condition your hair, work a scoop or two of coconut oil into your hair. Then, wait at least 15 minutes before rinsing your hair thoroughly. Your hair will be super conditioned! [7] X Research source Your hair should feel super soft and sleek by the time you finish drying off.

steps.title: It’s not the end of the world if you do, but it’s probably not a good idea.
steps.content: It’s not the end of the world if you do, but it’s probably not a good idea. Coconut oil is comedogenic, which is a fancy way of saying it clogs pores. While this might not be a huge deal for you, it can make your scalp and skin oily or lock debris in your pores. Over time, this can cause you to break out. Overdoing it with the oil can also make your hair feel greasy, which can be unpleasant. [8] X Research source Using it a few times a week is probably okay, though. You can always just do this whenever you wash your hair in the shower if you only wash your hair a few times a week. You should be able to feel if you’re using too much. If you start getting pimples around your hairline, your skin feels greasy, or the texture of your hair feels kind of off, just cut back on how often you use coconut oil.

steps.title: They’re liquefying it so they can put it into their hair.
steps.content: They’re liquefying it so they can put it into their hair. Quality coconut oil turns solid around room temperature. Depending on how cold your home is, the coconut oil may solidify. This really isn’t a big deal if it happens, though. You can just place a chunk of the oil in a microwave-safe bowl and heat it on low for a few seconds. [9] X Research source You can even warm it up in your hands. It doesn’t take much heat to make coconut oil melt. Some people believe that the hotter the oil is, the better it is for your hair. In all likelihood, it probably doesn’t matter if the oil is hot or not. So long as it’s liquefied, it will be good for your hair. [10] X Research source

steps.title: You should use extra virgin coconut oil for the best results.
steps.content: You should use extra virgin coconut oil for the best results. Less purified forms of coconut oil may contain very trace amounts of bleach and other chemicals that may damage your hair. Some of those chemicals may irritate your scalp as well. If you’re going to put coconut oil in your hair, look for 100% pure extra virgin coconut oil. [11] X Research source
